summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York to other case personnel, discussing the status of FBI interview reports (302s) and handwritten notes. The sender notes over 120 interviews have been conducted and identifies gaps in documentation, requesting follow-up on specific missing items.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Sender of the email, coordinating the review of FBI 302s and interview notes for the Epstein case.

events.title: Case Document Review Coordination
events.description: An AUSA emails colleagues to address loose ends in the case documentation, specifically regarding missing FBI 302s and interview notes.

keyFacts: Over 120 interviews have been conducted in the Epstein case.
The prosecution team has completed a full review and cross-reference of all case materials.
There are gaps in documentation, specifically three interviews with notes but no formal 302 reports, and a larger number with 302s but no handwritten notes.
The email is a request for colleagues to double-check for missing interview notes, particularly for certain highlighted interviews.
